issues_comment_text:
@yukkysaito それであれば書き換えても問題ないと思うのですが, できましたらその旨をコミットログに書いていただけないでしょうか. 今後からで良いので.

#### 例

```
Correct copyright license

Because all of this code is written by me.
```

全員(弊社含む)に言えるのかもしれないですが, コミットログはより具体的に書いていただけるとよいと思います(コードを変更したとかは見ればわかるので, 特に書く必要はない). バグを直した場合は, こういう場合にバグが発生したので直したとか具体的に書いてあると後からログを見た時にどういう修正をしたかが理解しやすくなります.

例えば  96c3b77ea3bfb83b5bdeb16882b104ffedde22f3 の場合,  `fixed bug of init`とありますが, これだけでは意味を把握することが難しいです.  私自身理解できていないので間違っているかもしれないですが, zero clearしていないので○○な問題が発生していたとか, 最後に `max_y`, `min_y`を `NO_DATA`にリセットしていなかったため xxな問題が起きていた等も記述していただけるとよいかと思います. (後から見た時に同じ問題に気をつけないともなります).

githubを利用しているので issueを立てそこに具体的な問題を書き, `Fix issue #xx`のように書くのでもよいかと思います. (この場合でも具体的にコミットログを書くに越したことはないですが)

issues_comment_text: 現状 hydroを使っているケース, もしくは Ubuntu 13.04, Ubuntu 13.10を使っているケースというのはあるのでしょうか ? それがなければマージしようと考えています. 問題等ありましたら, お知らせください.

13系とhydroはサポート中止しましょう。READMEに13系とhydro使いたければ今日以前のコミットをチェックアウトするよう注意書を追加できますか。
2015/10/21 19:20 "Syohei YOSHIDA" notifications@github.com:

> 現状 hydroを使っているケース, もしくは Ubuntu 13.04, Ubuntu 13.10を使っているケースというのはあるのでしょうか ?
> それがなければマージしようと考えています. 問題等ありましたら, お知らせください.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/CPFL/Autoware/pull/94#issuecomment-149847734.
注意書きを追加しました.
I have merged. Please report if you have any bulld issue.

なぜそうする必要があるのでしょうか ? パッケージ版では動かないというような問題があるのでしょうか ? (jadeでは velodyne-pointcloudパッケージは提供されていないので, ソースから構築する必要がありましたが). パッケージ版を使うべきでない理由があるのであれば, そのことを明記すべきだと思います.

またソースコードからビルドする際, リビジョンの指定が特にないのですが, 最新版で常にビルドできることが保証されているのでしょうか, また動作保証ができているのでしょうか ?

特定のバージョンを利用する必要がある, パッケージ版では問題がある等であれば, ソースコードを手動でチェックアウトするのではなく, git submodule, subtree等を使った方がよいと思います.

よろしくお願いします.

aptで提供されているパッケージ版ではyaml-cpp 0.5のサポートが不十分で、実際にキャリブレーションファイルの読み込みができませんでした。当時の最新ソースコードではその問題が修正されていたので、ソースからビルドする形に切り替えたという経緯があります。

git subtreeというものがあるのですね。初めて知りました。
これはあるコミットタイミングでのvelodyneリポジトリをAutowareに取り込むという理解でよろしいでしょうか。
不勉強で申し訳ありません。

よろしくお願いします。

> aptで提供されているパッケージ版ではyaml-cpp 0.5のサポートが不十分で、実際にキャリブレーションファイルの読み込みができませんでした。当時の最新ソースコードではその問題が修正されていたので、ソースからビルドする形に切り替えたという経緯があります。

これは indigoでの話でしょうか ? indigoのパッケージだとバージョン 1.2.0が使われており, そのバージョンには yaml-cpp 0.5に対するサポートが含まれているように見えます(以下のコミットが含まれる.)

https://github.com/ros-drivers/velodyne/commit/0b7a20918f65962f1bf0b4183722589aef239584

パッケージ版が利用できる方が, ユーザ的にもメンテな的にも便利なので, それで動くかどうかよろしければ
確認いただけないでしょうか ?

> git subtreeというものがあるのですね。初めて知りました。
> これはあるコミットタイミングでのvelodyneリポジトリをAutowareに取り込むという理解でよろしいでしょうか。
> 不勉強で申し訳ありません。

はい, そのような認識でよいです.

> これは indigoでの話でしょうか ? indigoのパッケージだとバージョン 1.2.0が使われており, そのバージョンには yaml-cpp 0.5に対するサポートが含まれているように見えます(以下のコミットが含まれる.)
> 
> ros-drivers/velodyne@0b7a209

確かサポートはされているが内部的なバグがあった覚えがあります。
この後のコミットの
ros-drivers/velodyne@fc20169
ros-drivers/velodyne@fdba8a3
によりそのバグが修正されたようです。
これは1.2.0以後のものなのでおそらく1.2.0ではまだ修正されていないはずですが、一度確認してみます。

http://repos.ros.org/repos/building/pool/main/r/ros-indigo-velodyne-pointcloud/

パッケージのソースコードを見ると, その変更はまだ取り込まれていないようです.
READMEを修正します.

お手数おかけして申し訳ありません。
それではgit subtreeにて取り込む形に成るということでしょうか。
とりあえずその方向で試してみます

すでに `velodyne`というパッケージ(`sensing/drivers/lidar/packages/velodyne/`)があるので単純に `ros/src`の下に置くということはできませんでした(こうすると catkin_init_workspaceやら source devel/setup.bashをせずに済むのですが...). 依存関係用のディレクトリを作成し, その下に submoduleを置くことにします.

マージしました.

velodyne-pointcloudパッケージを submoduleとして追加しました.
`./catkin_make_release`コマンドを使ってビルドを行う場合は何の問題もないはずです. cakin_makeコマンドを行う場合は, 事前に `git submodule init && git submodule update`が必要になります.

問題があればお知らせください.
よろしくお願いします.

迅速な対応有難うございました。
こちらでも確認します。

ちなみに、`catkin_make`時に毎回`git submodule init && git submodule update`しなければならないのでしょうか。それとも一度`./catkin_make_release`した後に`catkin_make`をする場合は、上記は必要ないのでしょうか。

> ちなみに、catkin_make時に毎回git submodule init && git submodule updateしなければならないのでしょうか。それとも一度./catkin_make_releaseした後にcatkin_makeをする場合は、上記は必要ないのでしょうか。

一度だけでいいです. `ros/depends/src/velodyne`以下にソースコードが取得されていれば実行する必要はありません.

> 一度だけでいいです. ros/depends/src/velodyne以下にソースコードが取得されていれば実行する必要はありません.

承知いたしました。対応並びにご教示ありがとうございました。

本日外での実験で気づいたのですが、インターネット接続がない場合./catkin_make_releaseを実行するとvelodyneレポジトリのクローンで止まってしまいます。
外で実験をする場合インターネット接続がない場合が多数ですので、これは解決しないといけません。
タイムアウト時間を短くすればいいとは思うのですが、そのようなことは可能なのでしょうか。

Autowareの clone時に `--recursive`オプションをつけて submoduleも cloneしておくか,  インターネット下で一度でも構築しておけば問題は回避できると思います. それが無理な場合はソースコードをバンドル必要があると思います.

> 外で実験をする場合インターネット接続がない場合が多数ですので、これは解決しないといけません。
> タイムアウト時間を短くすればいいとは思うのですが、そのようなことは可能なのでしょうか。

タイムアウトする場合, 必要なソースコードがないということになってしまうので, 適切ではないものと思います.

1. 本家に変更を取り込んでもらい, 適用後 submoduleのリビジョンを更新する
2. パッチを同梱し, ビルドスクリプト実行時に適用する
3. velodyneを(一時的?)に forkし, その差分を適用, submoduleの参照先をそちらにする

のいずれかになるかと思います. 1.が最も望ましい形ではあると思いますが, packet_rateが
定まっていないということでマージは難しいのではないかと思います. PRの傾向を見ても
安易にマージしてくれるプロダクトではなさそう.

となると 2, 3でしょうか. 今後変更することがないのであれば, 2の方が楽かと思いますが,
変更を頻繁に行う可能性がるとなると 3でしょうか.

@syohex @manato
先生との議論の結果、3で行くことになりました。
また、submoduleの置く場所ですが、
元あった/ros/src/sensing/drivers/lidar/packages/velodyneパッケージを削除してその場所に置き、元あったvelodyneパッケージにあるlaunchファイルをsubmoduleのほうに移動させることでdependsディレクトリを使わずに済むようになると思います。
仕様が二転三転して大変申し訳ありません。
このような形でよろしいでしょうか。
それでうまくいくかをとりあえず試してみようかと思います.

https://github.com/CPFL/Autoware/pull/90#issuecomment-154310428 に対応するための PRを出しました. https://github.com/CPFL/Autoware/pull/114 ご確認ください. よろしくお願いします.

Velodyneパッケージは https://github.com/CPFL/velodyne に forkしました. 本家と同期を取るために masterブランチは手を付けずに Autowareブランチを利用するようにしています.

@syohex 
対応有難うございます。
subtreeの仕様になれることが出来れば大変使いやすいものに感じました。
velodyneドライバを編集した後のpushには気をつけます。
ただ、subtreeであることを知らない方が修正し、間違ってpushしてしまうこともありえますので、周知するようにReadmeなどに記載をお願いできますでしょうか。

https://github.com/CPFL/Autoware/commit/ab8dfb617f646434f3dc8e74c4a332a43e8f85f3

追加しました.

@syohex , @h-ohta 
ご対応ありがとうございます。大丈夫だと思いますので、マージをお願い致します。
マージしました.

I have integrated velodyne source code into this repository as `git subtree`. Original repository is here(https://github.com/CPFL/velodyne), this is forked version. Please be careful for changing velodyne code from this repository. That may break repository history. You must learn about `git subtree`, `git subtree push`, `git subtree split` etc.

Velodyneのソースコードを Autowareリポジトリに `git subtree`として取り込みました. オリジナルは https://github.com/CPFL/velodyne にあります(本家の fork版です). velodyneのコードを本リポジトリから修正する場合は注意が必要です. 他のソースコードと同じように `git push`をすると履歴がいろいろと壊れます. 変更する場合は, `git subtree push`, `git subtree split`を使う必要があります.

@syohex 
subtreeを編集し、`git subtree push` を行おうとしたのですが、
403で弾かれてしまいます。
権限などはどうなっていますでしょうか？
`git subtree push`の際, どのようなコマンドを実行したか示していただけないでしょうか ?
無理なようでしたら, https://github.com/CPFL/velodyne を直接操作していただくというのでも良いですが.
申し訳ありませんが、適宜ignoreファイルを追加おねがいします

ignoreファイルは以下に存在しています.

```
% git ls-files | grep .gitignore
ros/.gitignore
ros/src/computing/perception/detection/packages/road_wizard/.gitignore
ros/src/sensing/drivers/gnss/packages/javad_navsat_driver/.gitignore
ros/src/sensing/fusion/packages/calibration_camera_lidar/.gitignore
ros/src/sensing/fusion/packages/points2image/.gitignore
ros/src/util/packages/RobotSDK/glviewer/.gitignore
ros/src/util/packages/RobotSDK/rosinterface/.gitignore
ros/src/util/packages/runtime_manager/scripts/.gitignore
ui/tablet/AutowareRider/.gitignore
ui/watch/Voice/.gitignore
ui/watch/Voice/mobile/.gitignore
ui/watch/Voice/wear/.gitignore
ui/watch/mapdemo/.gitignore
ui/watch/mapdemo/app/.gitignore
ui/watch/mapdemo/mobile/.gitignore
vehicle/zmp/hv/.gitignore
vehicle/zmp/hv2/.gitignore
```

旧リポジトリは以下のようになっていました.

```
# GNU global tags
GTAGS
GRTAGS
GSYMS
GPATH

# Python byte-compile file
__pycache__/
*.py[co]

# editor backup files
*~
\#*\#

#eclipse settings
.cproject
.project
.pydevproject
.settings/
```
トップディレクトリ以外は同じはずなので, トップディレクトリだけ合わせれば済むものと思います.

> 承知いたしました。
> それではこちらで合わせてもよろしいでしょうか。

はいお願いします.
問題ないと思います.

Syohei YOSHIDA さんは書きました : 

> @amc-nu There is circular dependency between klt package and cv_tracker package. cv_tracker links klt library, while klt uses cv_tracker message headers.
> 
> Currently klt package does not declare its dependency about cv_tracker(There is add_dependencies, but this is not enough, because cv_tracker is not declared in CATKIN_DEPENDS and package.xml). Build is failed if I declare klt dependency by that CMake finds circular dependency and raises error as below.
> 
> CMake Error at /home/syohei/Autoware/ros/build/catkin_generated/order_packages.cmake:179 (message): Circular dependency in subset of packages: cv_tracker, klt 
> 
> klt library is linked only from cv_tracker so I suppose klt library need not to be the own package.
> How about you ?
> 
> You can view, comment on, or merge this pull request online at:
> 
>   https://github.com/CPFL/Autoware/pull/76
> 
> Commit Summary
> 
> Fix circular dependency 
>

issues_comment_text:
By the way, Almost all Autoware programs which depend on OpenCV cannot be built on ROS kinetic, because ROS kinetic bundles OpenCV3 and forces developers to use OpenCV3 by default. Developers cannot use OpenCV2 in general. Some Autoware programs uses deprecated OpenCV functions, classes, structures, they are removed on OpenCV3. If Autoware supports ROS kinetic in the future, we should consider to rewrite some programs with OpenCV3.

And some ROS packages which are used by Autoware are missed in ROS kinentic.
- sound_play
- nmea-msgs

ROS kinentic supports both Qt4 and Qt5, so we can remove some Qt5 hacks from CMakeList.txt.

See also
- http://wiki.ros.org/kinetic/Migration

issues_comment_text:
@syohex 
PCLのFilterとRegistrationモジュールの必要な部分をfast_pclとして追加しました。
ndt_matching.cppでは、インクルードするヘッダをpcl/registration/ndt.h<-->fast_pcl/registration/ndt.hで切り替えられることは確認しました。
PCLのソースコード自体は変更していませんが、ライブラリとして追加することに関して、何か問題ないか確認していただけないでしょうか?

ビルドが通りません. 

```
/home/syohei/Autoware/ros/src/computing/perception/localization/lib/fast_pcl/regis
tration/include/fast_pcl/registration/impl/correspondence_estimation.hpp:44:35: fa
tal error: pcl/common/copy_point.h: No such file or directory
 #include <pcl/common/copy_point.h>
```

Ubuntu 14.04の `pcl-1.7`パッケージは 1.7.1なので, copy_point.hが含まれていません. [https://github.com/PointCloudLibrary/pcl](https://github.com/PointCloudLibrary/pcl)を見たところ, 1.7.2から含まれているヘッダファイルのようですが, どのようにこの問題を回避すればよろしいでしょうか ?

こちらの環境を確認してみたところ、1.7.2でした。
ユーザーにlibpcl-1.7のバージョンを1.7.2にアップデートしてもらうという方法で回避するというのではだめでしょうか?

その場合 Ubuntu 14.04での利用者にソースコードからのビルドを要求することになってしまうので, 良い考えとはいえないと思います. 必須の機能でなければ, 低いバージョンの libpclを利用している場合はビルドしないというのはいかがでしょうか ?

(Ubuntu 15.04, Ubuntu 16.04では libpcl 1.7.2がパッケージからインストールできることを確認しました.)
Ubuntu 15.04 ROS jadeではビルドできることは確認できました.

Ubuntu 14.04の場合、ros-indigo-desktop-fullをインストールした際に、一緒にインストールされるlibpcl-1.7のバージョンが1.7.1みたいですね。
その場合、
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:v-launchpad-jochen-sprickerhof-de/pcl
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get dist-upgrade
とすれば、libpcl-1.7のバージョンを1.7.2に更新できることを確認しました。
1番いいのは上記の方法でlibpcl-1.7のバージョンを1.7.2にしてもらうことだと思います。しかし、1.7.1の場合は、ビルドしないという方法がいいかと思いますが、そうするとndt_matchingでfast_pcl/registration/ndt.hをインクルードした場合、エラーが出ると思いますが、どのように対処したらいいのでしょうか...
APIが同じということであれば, ビルド時にバージョンをチェックして, ifdefで切り分けるので良いと思います.(CMakeで `find_package(PCL)`すれば, `${PCL_VERSION}`でバージョンは取れます.)

find_package(PCL)とし、PCLのバージョンを取得することはできたのですが、CMakeの書き方に習熟しておらず思うように動作をしないので、PCLバージョンをチェックして、1.7.2以降ならばfast_pclをコンパイル、ndt_localizerのCMakeListsでfast_pclをリンク、1.7.1ならばfast_pclのコンパイル、リンクをしないというように変更していただけないでしょうか?お手数をおかけして申し訳ありません。
まだ変更内容がよくわかっていないので, 確認から行ってみます.

https://github.com/CPFL/Autoware/pull/335/commits/1c85e501ce999aa026819619540301e70974408b の修正を確認していただけないでしょうか ? 
Ubuntu 14.04 + pcl 1.7.1と Ubuntu 15.04 + pcl 1.7.2でそれぞれビルドできることは確認しました.

Ubuntu 14.04 + pcl 1.7.2 の場合でもビルドできることを確認しましたのでマージします。
ご協力いただきましてありがとうございます。

Great!

issues_comment_text: There are many conflicts with #234. I'll create PR again and apply clang-format files which are added by #234.

Please don't merge master branch except your changes conflict with master branch codes. To merge master branch make us difficult to understand what PR changes/improves like this PR.

(名古屋大学の方全般なのですが)変更がコンフリクトしない限りは, masterをマージする必要はないです. 下手にマージするとコミット履歴がこのようにカオスになるだけです. こうなると本質的な変更がなんなのかが極めて見えづらくなってしまいます.

Please remove `*.orig` files.

*.origファイルが含まれています. 削除してください.
Thank you for your advice. I'm careful not to do it.
*.orig files are removed at f8c4fda
マージは自由にしていただいて構わないです.

一般論です(この PRだけを言及するものではないです).

#### Pull Requestの作成
- 必要最小限の変更にする
  - 例えばこの PRは 55ファイルを 52コミットで変更しているが, そこまで必要なのか. (本質的に必要であれば何の問題もない.)
  - (不要である mergeが含まれるため多く見えてしまっている)
  - PRのタイトル以外のことをしていないか.
  - ここまで多いと cherry-pickすることも難しい
  - 多くなる場合は分割できないかの検討. 特に複数のことを実現している場合
- 不要なコミットの削除
  - あとで第三者が `git log`をした場合に有用なもののみ残す
  - 自分のコミットの誤りを修正するコミットは履歴に不要(rebaseで誤り自体をなかったことにする)
  - 誤ってファイルを追加した場合は, 誤ってファイルを追加してしまったこと自体を消す
  - 自分が同一 PR内で追加したバグを修正するバグ等も同様.
@syohex アドバイスありがとうございます。今後のコミット履歴の事も考え、出来る限り最小限の変更でのコミットにするように注意いたします。

Why did you think that fallback is necessary ?

We can install eigen3 packages via `apt-get install`. And `ros-indigo-desktop-full` package contains eigen3 packages.

With newer version of CMake it cannot find Eigen3 even when it is
installed. I faced it and found this to the best workaround from ROS and
PCL issue log. I think the fallback(only if invoked when primary method
fails to find Eigen3) has dependency on ros-indigo-camke-modules

Runtime Managerとroscoreを終了しても、proc_managerが残っているようにみえます。
勘違いだったらすみません。

> Runtime Managerとroscoreを終了しても、proc_managerが残っているようにみえます。
> 勘違いだったらすみません。

現在対応を検討中です. とりあえず起動時に同名プロセスは全部 killするようにはしています.
`run`と同ディレクトリにある `cleanup`スクリプトでも同様のことができます.
(runtime managerの終了時に killさせようにも rootとして動いているので, そこでまたパスワード入力が必要になるなど単純にはいかないところがあります. いい方法がないか検討します.)

issues_title: Fix crash on NDT mapping gpu
issues_comment_text:
@YamatoAndo I see. So your GPU cannot handle around 20 million points.
I am working on a solution for that out of memory problem. By dividing the input point cloud into smaller chunks (around 2 millions points per each) and process them one by one, the out of memory problem can be avoided. However, I am not sure about the accuracy of this implementation method. Though when I ran it on my pc, the output map looks the same as when using CPU, I still need more tests.

@amc-nu - by a traffic pole you mean a horizontal bar holding the actual lights?

Another question is how does vector map now encode lane to traffic light relation?

issues_title: Feature/tlr turn support, multi traffic signal support
issues_comment_text:
@dejanpan yes, a pole is the complete metallic bar either horizontal, vertical or a mix of both.
The VectorMap includes the closest LaneId for each of the bulbs in a traffic signal. The LaneId is a point that belongs to a Lane. A Lane is composed by a series of LaneIDs

issues_comment_text: Yes!
@hatem-darweesh this is a really large PR. Can you please explain where does the motivation come from? What are the exact benefits of this PR?

@dejanpan It is part of TierIV requirements , to merge latest OpenPlanner into master branch by splitting it into separate nodes. 
Objectives are: 
- Separate different parts of OpenPlanner into small nodes 
- Refactor and use latest development for the past 8 month.
@hatem-darweesh so the code is now more modular. Is it also more performant?
@dejanpan Yeah, current code is optimized, more readable and planning performance is much faster. (100 hz on average)
@hatem-darweesh @yk-fujii same here. It is impossible that change in 75 files is without bugs. Such PR must be thoroughly reviewed, discussed and there must be test.
@kitsukawa @daifuku07 I tried to understand what this PR is about but it is not possible. Could you maybe provide a short description?

@dejanpan ndt_{maching, mapping} using NDT algorithm in PCL. ndt_tku is implemented without NDT algorithm of PCL. But the interface between ndt_tku and PCL was different. So, this PR is that ndt_tku was refactored.

Could you set a "false" to default arg?
thanks for cooperation.
ok. sure. of course.

Thanks! I had merge this PR.

Before this commit, we used "add_custom_command" like the code dejanpan references.
In this method, since the file is regenerated every time although there is no change, it took useless time to build.
After this commit, I modified to use "automoc" "autouic", and automatically generate it if necessary.
Also, until now, we have created moc _ *. cpp and ui _ *. h under src. Now it is no longer under src, so .gitignore is deleted accordingly.

Ubuntu 16.04
ROS: 1.12.7 kinetic

Thanks @aohsato I successfully compiled the branch in Indigo, do you have any plans to add the `[app]` window in RTM?

### How to test:

---

`roslaunch points_preprocessor points_concat_filter.launch input0:=/front/velodyne_points input1:=/rear/velodyne_points sensor_frame:=velodyne`

---

@aohsato I was able to perform cloud merging. However, I recommend to use `ApproximateTime` instead of `TimeSynchronizer`, the node is **dropping** most of the frames. Leading to a frequency **less than 1 fps**

@aohsato Finally, I recommend to change the param name `sensor_frame` to `output_frame`. I think it is easier to understand what is it doing (without the need to check the source code. This is up to you, please decide if you want to change it or not).
Also please try to follow Google's C++ Style Guide, specially **Naming** https://google.github.io/styleguide/cppguide.html

@amc-nu Thx for your appropriate reviews and comments!!!
I fixed them, added options to runtime manager and pushed, would you please check?

And then, you have to use this correct command for testing with your rosbag, including tf links between **base_link** and velodyne_front/rear.
I already used ApproximateTimePolicy. :)

```sh
roslaunch points_preprocessor points_concat_filter.launch \
  input0:=/front/velodyne_points input1:=/rear/velodyne_points output_frame:=base_link
```

Or please use this runtime_manager like this.

![screenshot from 2017-10-29 00-13-01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1531482/32135693-4d72b470-bc3e-11e7-98d8-a10655213ac2.png)

```

Furthermore, I plan to modify this code to use multiple (> 2) lidars for next PR.
Note SyncPolicy can obtain pointcloud by up to 9 topics, but I must set them by cpp-template. I want to change the number of topics at runtime.

-  message_generation

- cv_bridge

@yk-fujii how does this work? Does it check if any crosswalks intersect with the planned path?

It is applied by checking [Use Crosswalk Detection]and [Enable Multiple Crosswalk Detection] in the append window of velocity_set.

Conventionally, only [Use Crosswalk Detection] was existed.
[Use Crosswalk Detection] function control a velocity by detection pedestrians on the closest crosswalk with the planned path.

This feature add [Enable Multiple Crosswalk Detection] function.
[Enable Multiple Crosswalk Detection] function detect pedestrians on the multiple crosswalks with the planned path.

issues_comment_text: @amc-nu just out of curiosity, do you guys don't do review on every pull request?

Major pull requests are reviewed. Minor ones are not, due to our resource
constraints. If you are willing to help us out for reviews, that is
appreciated. We can set the policy of pull requests more strict then.

.

@shinpei0208 I do not want to disrupt your process but this is how I see a solid, bullet proof yet lean development cycle:

- if you are working on a feature/bug/new-release => create an issue 
- create a branch, work on the feature/bug/new-release, **refer in at least one commit to the issue #Number** 
- open pull request for given feature/bug/new-release but use a pull request template. See:
  - https://gist.github.com/dejanpan/01927c164025b973b54dbe0b490bef65
  - https://github.com/blog/2111-issue-and-pull-request-templates

This would assure that we know where the feature originated from and the implementation would be linked to the feature request (or bug report). Otherwise there is absolutely no tracebility.
Secondly, with the pull request template it will be easier for the reviewer(s) to understand the changes and we can later on convert "Steps to Reproduce" into integration tests. 
For the integration tests I talked to @amc-nu and will be in the next days proposing some changes.
And I am of course also happy to help with the review process.

Was there a bug report or why was this change needed?

It would be really great if we all got into the habit of listing how did we test the change (see PR template that I am proposing): https://gist.github.com/dejanpan/01927c164025b973b54dbe0b490bef65#file-pull-request-template-md

This is @shinpei0208 's order.

I will use templates from next time.

velodyne
-->velodyne_compression
---->CMakeLists.txt
---->package.xml
---->src
------>compress2png.cpp
------>recon2packet.cpp
------>driver.h

Compile Error occurs.
Add 2 lines below in the bottom of the CMakeLists.txt
`add_dependencies(compress2png velodyne_compression_generate_messages_cpp)`
`add_dependencies(recon2packet velodyne_compression_generate_messages_cpp)`

And can you remove the unnecessary lines in the CMakeLists.txt?

## Status
**PRODUCTION**

## Description
Real-time compressing/decompressing velodyne packet data. Date from HDL64E, HDL64ES2, HDL64ES3, HDL32E and VLP_16 are supported.  Compression ratio is around 1/3. Decompressed points may have a little bias which is less than 1cm.

## Related PRs
None.

## Todos
Sorry, I'm not sure about the meaning of Tests and Documentation. I do not cover the test data in the file.

## Steps to Test or Reproduce

Compression:
 Start compression node
`rosrun compression compress2png`
Then play your file which should have /velodyne_packets topic:
`rosbag play yourfile.bag`
Compression node will compress packet data into a new topic /velodyne_packets_compressed
You can use 
`rosbag record /velodyne_packets_compressed`
to get the compressed data.

Decompression:
Start decompression node
`rosrun compression recon2packet`
Then play the compressed data which should have /CompressedPacket topic:
`rosbag play compresseddata.bag`
Then a reconstructed  /velodyne_packets will be built

Could you please check this one @yk-fujii @dejanpan @messi49 ?
Workflow of testing:
**Input:**
/points_raw (Velodyne PointCloud)
**Output:**
/points_no_ground (Velodyne PointCloud with Ground Filtered)
/points_ground (Velodyne PointCloud including only the points estimated as ground)

How to run:
1. Play ROSBAG with velodyne sensor data
2. Run velodyne_pointcloud conversion node (if necessary)
3. Run this filter
```rosrun points_preprocessor ground_filter _sensor_model:=X```

Where X might be 16, 32, 64 according to the number of beams of the Velodyne Sensor

If you wish to include Euclidean clustering in the test, set the Euclidean cluster params to:
1. *remove_ground* to False
2. *input_point_clound* to points_no_ground

Referencing autowarefoundation/autoware_ai#949

@amc-nu thank you so much for cleaning up my messy code. If you could give me a suggestion about what documentation I should read in order to code properly, I would be really grateful.

Actually, this version has some bugs in it. Some points are missing. Meaning that those points have never been published. I will commit the fixed one based on your revised version now.

I tried the code on this bag: http://db3.ertl.jp/autoware/sample_data/sample_moriyama_150324.tar.gz using these commands:
```
$ rosbag play sample_moriyama_150324.bag
$ rosrun points_preprocessor ground_filter _sensor_model:=32
$ rosrun rviz rviz
```
Then I added blue point cloud as ground and red point cloud as non ground. From the attached screenshot you will see that blue point reach densely up to 0.5m above the ground and some sparse blue points are also way above the ground. So I'd conclude that the algorithm doesn't quite work correctly yet.

![ground_removal](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17376/28607070-fad3601a-718e-11e7-9530-3c38cdd8eb7f.png)

How should we do, merge this PR and create an issue to fix the algorithm or we improve the algorithm in this branch?
@amc-nu @n-patiphon what are we gonna do with this PR? Did you see my latest commit?

@dejanpan we're deciding now.
I think the best would be to merge and fix it, like you mentioned.@n-patiphon will add a README and a launch file before merging.
I am fine with that. Will you create an issue for fix?
Yes, I'm just waiting for feedback from @n-patiphon to proceed.
@n-patiphon any update?

Merged. This is still missing:

a )generates a pdf from https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B8iMqYxCmvZAZGRVOUhVQmhsSVE/view?usp=sharing
b) upload it https://github.com/CPFL/Autoware-Manuals/tree/master/en
c) Add the following block here: https://github.com/CPFL/Autoware/blob/046b973dae7e21b1cfa73f772fade9557e5b1157/ros/src/sensing/filters/packages/points_preprocessor/nodes/ground_filter/ground_filter.cpp#L5
```
/**
 * @brief Below algorithm is documented here <link to pdf>.
 */
```
d) create issue for the functional bug as reported in this comment: https://github.com/CPFL/Autoware/pull/655#issuecomment-317958314.

I can do all of it if you want.
@dejanpan if you could do it, it would be a great help. Thanks.

@amc-nu  @dejanpan 
There are two filters for ground/no-ground segmentation in autoware, right? Is there any data set with annotation and labels to measure their performance? Which one is better? What is advantages and disadvantages of each one?

issues_comment_text:
@kitsukawa ,

I implemented additional function to visualize `lane_detector` result in `image_viewer_plugin`.
Could you please confirm this PR?
Any comment including your preference regarding visualization result (line color, thickness...etc) would be appreciated.

Thank you!

issues_title: Add function to visualize lane_detect result
issues_comment_text:
I had a confirm instead of @kitsukawa.
It was merged it.
Thanks.

issues_title: Add function to visualize lane_detect result
issues_comment_text: @yk-fujii @manato Thank you.

@amc-nu , @yk-fujii , and other Autoware developers,

I met compiling error when I tried to compile latest `develop` branch.
The brief error was followings:
```
Autoware/ros/src/util/packages/kitti_pkg/kitti_player/src/kitti_player.cpp:27:
/opt/ros/indigo/include/ros/console.h:353:61: error: cannot bind ‘std::basic_ostream<char>’ lvalue to ‘std::basic_ostream<char>&&’

.....

Autoware/ros/src/util/packages/kitti_pkg/kitti_player/src/kitti_player.cpp:1233:21: note: in expansion of macro ‘ROS_ERROR_STREAM’
                     ROS_ERROR_STREAM("Fail to open " << timestamps);
```
As I found that `<<` operator in `ROS_ERROR_STREAM` doesn't seem to be able to use with ifstream,
I made some modifications to fix this compile error.

Would you please check whether this PR is appropriate?
Thank you very much for your cooperation.

@yk-fujii , 
Thx for quick work!
@yk-fujii Can you check it can be built on Ubuntu 16.04/ROS Kinetic?

This pull request does not follow the branching model of Autoware.
Can you check the branching model below first?
https://github.com/CPFL/Autoware/blob/develop/docs/en/branching_model.md
Checkout new branch feature/orb_slam_tc from develop branch. Commit your change in that branch. After that, send pull request again into develop from feature/orb_slam_tc.
Sorry for inconvenience.

issues_comment_text:
@amc-nu, sorry, i am not sure which branch you are saying. is this?:
https://github.com/CPFL/Autoware/commits/feature/kinetic
in this branch, the dependencies between packages are not defined correctly and I cannot compile all packages correctly.
anyways, i guess i can merge my branch into yours.

IMO, msg files should be separated from some specific packages, [here](http://answers.ros.org/question/82711/separate-package-for-messages/) is the discussion on that topic.  
official packages such as std_msgs, sensor_msgs, etc. are maintained as I mentioned.
// honestly, this pr is not sufficient and i need to replace every 
```add_definition(xxx yyy_generate_messages_cpp) ``` line to ```add_dependencies(xxx ${catkin_EXPORTED_TARGETS})```.

issues_title: Refactor OpenPlanner code following ROS C++ code style
issues_comment_text:
@hatem-darweesh this looks great, thanks for taking the time to flesh out the code. Did you use `clang-format`? Dave Coleman put up this `clang-format` configuration file that matches the ROS1 C++ code style:

https://github.com/davetcoleman/roscpp_code_format

In addition to that, ROS2 also has a configuration file for `uncrustify` with the ROS2 code style (the ROS1 code style guide will eventually converge with ROS2's):

https://github.com/ament/ament_lint/blob/master/ament_uncrustify/ament_uncrustify/configuration/ament_code_style.cfg

I'm working on integrating ROS2's build system (ament) with Autoware, which will bring automatic code style checking (in addition to other stuff), you can have a look at it at:

https://github.com/esteve/Autoware/tree/feature/use_ament_vector_map

ament supersedes catkin and does not require ROS2, so we can use it with Autoware and ROS1.

Adding automatic code checking and generating a test report is as simple as adding these two lines:

https://github.com/esteve/Autoware/commit/849e1261cd4678de5407085d68cc2b380103e04b#diff-d47e2c80dcb7a36bc8d73ffcb44993bdR57

issues_title: Refactor OpenPlanner code following ROS C++ code style
issues_comment_text:
@esteve Thank you for the information. 
yes, I used clang format. as explained in #1771 

That would be great for new code , what about the existing one? should I stop refactoring OpenPlanner? 
I am looking forward to use ROS2 with Autoware. 

do you recommend to use ROS2 code style from now ? 
what is the difference between using "ament" and "colcon" as build tools ?

issues_title: Refactor OpenPlanner code following ROS C++ code style
issues_comment_text:
> That would be great for new code , what about the existing one?

Eventually all existing code will be ported to ament, so that the migration to ROS2 is easier.

> should I stop refactoring OpenPlanner?

Feel free to keep making changes to OpenPlanner, of course :-) But now that colcon will be part of Autoware 1.10 and ament will be in 1.11, we have the opportunity to add the ament linters to existing packages. However, this shouldn't block you from refactoring OpenPlanner, we can always port it to ament after or during 1.11.

> I am looking forward to use ROS2 with Autoware.

So am I! :-)

> do you recommend to use ROS2 code style from now ?

Both styles are very very very similar, my recommendation is that you continue with the changes you're making and we merge them, and once we have the ament infrastructure in Autoware, we can port OpenPlanner to ament and check if your changes pass the ROS2 checks.

> what is the difference between using "ament" and "colcon" as build tools ?

Basically, a build system comprises the functions and macros that are added to a build definition to find a package's dependencies (e.g. the build_depend tags in package.xml help rosdep install the dependencies), how to generate messages, etc.

A build tool is the program that knows how to read the metadata (package.xml) and the build definition (CMakeLists.txt) to produce a library or an executable.

Back in ROS1, the build system and the build tool were the same: catkin. catkin_make could only build catkin packages. In ROS2, we introduced ament, the evolution of the catkin build system, and had to create ament_tools to support the ament build system.

But that was just too messy, because now you needed a different tool for a different build system, and to solve that, colcon was created. colcon understands packages that are written for the catkin (ROS1), ament (ROS2), CMake, setuptools (Python), Gradle (Java), etc. build systems, so we can now use the same tool for building workspaces that contain packages for different build systems.

This is a huge benefit for us, because we can have code written for ROS1 that use the catkin build system, but also ROS1 packages with the ROS2 build system (ament), and packages entirely written for ROS2 all in the same workspace. So instead of rewriting Autoware entirely for ROS2, we can do it step by step: first convert the build system of some of the packages to ament, add the ros1_bridge, add new packages that use ROS2, etc.

The link I pasted before is just an example of a ROS1 package, ported to ament and showing how the ament linters help keeping the code clean.

Dear @hakuturu583, I already received written permission from original author to release the file in BSD license, and pushed new commit. Can you please check it ? Thank you.

@gbiggs, Your request for switching to Apache 2.0 has been addressed. Regarding why this file (access_private.h) is required, it's because presently, ROS bag API protects bag file's index entry, which is required to read it in random fashion.
I looked at what you are doing and at the rosbag API. I think that because `rosbag::View` is a friend of `MessageInstance` you would be better off making a custom view to provide random access.

There two reasons that merely instancing the rosbag View class is not enough for random access bag:
1) There is a built-in iterator inside View class, but it is designed for sequential access
2) It is true that MessageInstance is friend of View, but not derivatives of View. Therefore I cannot access the index entries of all message instances directly, except it is made public (only possible when changing ROSbag API).

You would not necessarily have to follow the API of the `view` class since it's for an internal tool use.
However, you are right about not getting the friend privelages.

Using the approach of breaking the rosbag API is nasty and introduces maintainability issues. Here's what I think you should do:

- Since this is not going into 1.11, you need to make a fork and do a new PR from there anyway.
- In your fork, make one branch for each tool you are proposing so we can deal with each one individually.
- For the tool using rosbag, make the necessary changes in the rosbag API so you don't need to circumvent it. Propose them in a PR to the rosbag repository.
- Submit your tool as-is, but also submit a feature request to change it to use the changed rosbag API once that gets released in a ROS version we support (it is possible it would get released in Melodic if it doesn't change how the API is used for any other code).

We can accept the PR for that tool conditional on there being a proposal to change the rosbag API and your tool intending to use it in the future.
This needs to be merged to develop before the Autoware 1.10 cutoff so the links on the GtiHub repo point to the correct GitLab pipelines.
@kfunaoka @sgermanserrano got any feedback? Thanks.

issues_comment_text: This is now ready for review. These changes switch the build tool to `colcon`, the difference between `catkin_make` and `colcon` is that `colcon` can build both ROS1 (catkin) and ROS2 (ament) packages, whereas `catkin_make` can only build ROS1. This would allow developers to add ROS2 packages to Autoware.ai and build them from the same workspace without using two different build tools.

@kfunaoka I figured out why the runtime_manager is not available. The package files (i.e. CMakeLists.txt) are not properly written and thus the script is not installed. colcon requires all packages to be well-formed with installation targets, since the devel space no longer exists.

[Feature] Added functionality to run.sh in docker/generic
issues_comment_text:
@sgermanserrano @aohsato I've created a pull request https://github.com/sgermanserrano/Autoware/pull/1 into this pull request. Would you comment my pull request? I can modify or revert any of the changes in my pull request :)

## Description
- The first arg indigo|kinetic is removed for the inconsistency @aohsato mentioned, i.e., `./run.sh indigo -t 1.7.0-kinetic`
- Set default tag latest-kinetic
- Output image name and shared dir info even if tag and repo are not specified
- Add -h option for help

## Usage
- Option `-h` outputs `Usage: $0 [-t <tag>] [-r <repo>] [-s <Shared directory>]`
- Option `-t` specifies tag (Default: `latest-kinetic`)
- Option `-r` specifies repo (Default: `autoware/autoware`)
- Option `-s` specifies shared dir (Default: `/home/$USER/shared_dir`)
- `./run.sh` outputs `Using autoware/autoware:latest-kinetic` and `Shared directory: /home/$USER/shared_dir` even if tag and repo are not specified

@sgermanserrano @s-azumi @mitsudome-r I split some changes to autowarefoundation/autoware#1821 and autowarefoundation/autoware#1822. This pull request no longer has the changes of waypoint_maker and vector_map. I removed these packages from ToDo.
@s-azumi Would you revert some clang-format-only changes where you already made the revert commit👍
I've removed diagnostics_lib from ToDo. Thanks to 0c4070a37cecefc106c80a275d00d1882e9bee29, this pull request no longer modifies diagnostics_lib.
I've removed dp_planner from ToDo. The changes of dp_planner is reverted at 00679de and split into autowarefoundation/autoware#1919.
I've removed velocity_set from ToDo. The changes of velocity_set is reverted at 4e13070 and split into autowarefoundation/autoware#1919.
autowarefoundation/autoware#1920 and autowarefoundation/autoware#1921 fix the CI errors as shown in autowarefoundation/autoware#1921.

@kfunaoka @s-azumi I'd suggest checking for code coverage on _feature/rebuild_decision_maker_ once the tests for the individual components have been added and before merging to _develop_ in case something is missing

@sgermanserrano Thank you for the advice. I checked the coverage and it's not good enough.

I've discussed with @shinpei0208 and @gbiggs how we should go. Since all the activities in TierIV depend on this branch, we'd like to minimize the gap between what TierIV is doing and what the community can do. 

Would you mind our merging this branch as experimental with notifying on Runtime Manager GUI?

We decided requesting to create tests to software engineering company. Once the test can be created enough, we can remove the experimental label of decision_maker.

@kfunaoka @gbiggs I agree with the approach after merging autowarefoundation/autoware#2028 
Nevertheless, I think knowledge of the underlying algorithm is needed for the development of tests so I'm not sure the depth of testing that a software engineering company can bring. IMO improved documentation of the algorithms/nodes would improve testing contributions from the wider community

@sgermanserrano Thanks! Since We're very close to them, we'll improve tests and documentation with them. Since lack of the documentation and tests is making the utilization and contribution difficult, they are two of the most important things to do.

issues_comment_text: Closing this as invalid due to upcoming repository reorganisation.

> By making the above changes is the ids of the objects are consistently ?

Dear mouryaraj:
Yes, the ids will be stable.

We should associate the new detections to the current tracked objects.
In the original code, the order is reversed.

On the other hand, we shouldn't update Kalman Filter with predicted value.
We predict first, then associate the new detection, and finally update Kalman Filter.

issues_comment_text:
The questions above is about your experience after your following modification:

- Within Gitlab CI I've seen that the jobs some time fail with a "Run out of virtual memory" error -> Reducing the amount of parallel jobs when running catkin_make seems to solve the issue
- The previous point results in longer time to build -> The timeout is set to 1h by default, but it is straightforward to change it, I set it to 3h to be on the safe side but 2h should suffice

@kfunaoka See answers below:

- > Is it stable compared to Travis in your trials? Does network error or other error appear sometimes in your experience?

I have not yet experienced errors related to the network. The failed jobs were tied to bugs on the gitlab-ci files.

- > How long does the current tests (build & run_tests) takes? It seems there are one and half hour (1:23:18) and more than two hours (02:15:58). Does the difference between one and half hour and more than two hours seem to come from GitLab server load (or difference of test contents)? I think deep investigation is not necessary :)

I'm not sure how the time shown in the pipelines is calculated. If you go inside the pipelines [02:15:58](https://gitlab.com/ServandoGS/Autoware/pipelines/31993443/builds) & [1:23:18](https://gitlab.com/ServandoGS/Autoware/pipelines/32012833/builds), each job has taken less than 1h30min. It might be adding the time till the jobs started.

I've withdrawn autowarefoundation/autoware#1517 (which used Azure DevOps) in favor of this one. It'd be great to have this PR deployed as soon as possible, either on Gitlab's infrastructure or our own.
Is Travis CI going to be abandoned in favour of Gitlab CI? Since the current implementation of Travis CI using industrial_ci doesn't seem to support colcon / ament / ROS2 releases and cross builds?

issues_comment_text:
@dejanpan @kfunaoka this in no way aims to replace the work in https://gitlab.com/AutowareAuto/AutowareAuto but just as a temporary workaround for the current Travis woes (e.g. https://github.com/CPFL/Autoware/pull/1396). The functionality provided in this PR is equivalent to what we have now with Travis (i.e. fairly limited), but it's just to have something that runs reliably now.

Having said that, I wonder if it'd just make more sense to jump into GitLab right now and have the Apex CI replace the current Travis setup instead of dealing with temporary solutions like this PR.

to 'false' for a normal raw image format (but the frame rate is dropped).

@kfunaoka I've asked on the AutomouStuff repository if they could release the packages to the ROS index, that way we wouldn't have to use them as Git submodules (https://github.com/astuff/platform_automation_msgs/issues/7)
@esteve Thank you very much. It seems that `platform_automation_msgs` will be released via ROS index. I'm about to merge this pull request for v1.8, but it can be removed from next release.

@kfunaoka and @esteve - reproducing this message here from astuff/automotive_autonomy_msgs#7 for visibility:

Please be aware: This repository (previously platform_automation_msgs) and the packages under it are changing names. This was necessary to make the package names less generic and was required by the OSRF guys before the packages could be released into the build farm. These changes are covered in astuff/automotive_autonomy_msgs#8.

Looking at Autoware, the package module_comm_msgs was the only package used by that project which contained messages in this repo. The two messages that were used - SteerMode and SpeedMode - will now live under automotive_platform_msgs and this will need to be changed in Autoware to use the apt installs.

Note: This should not cause any changes with the current version of Autoware because the submodule is tied to a specific commit and a clone request for the previous repo name will redirect.
Commented on #1418

Or perhaps it'd just be better to pin the `platform_automation_msgs` module to a revision that still contained the `radar_msgs` package. The latest tagged revision still has it:

https://github.com/astuff/platform_automation_msgs/tree/v1.7.0
@esteve radar_msgs does not seems to be used in Autoware. Is it beneficial to add radar_msgs as submodule? Or another reason?

@kfunaoka that's true, `radar_msgs` is not being used in Autoware, but it was spun off from `platform_automation_msgs`, so using the latter's `master` branch now requires `astuff_sensor_msgs` to be in the workspace. We can avoid adding a new submodule for `astuff_sensor_msgs` by pinning the `platform_automation_msgs` submodule to the latest tagged release (1.7) which still shipped with `radar_msgs`. I've submitted https://github.com/CPFL/Autoware/pull/1420 instead, which just uses a tagged release for `platform_automation_msgs`

@esteve I understand. Autoware requires `platform_automation_msgs`, and `platform_automation_msgs` requires `astuff_sensor_msgs`. So #1417 or #1420 is required. It is difficult to select which one is better. For now, `platform_automation_msgs` v1.7 is good for us. #1420 is selected tentatively.
I'm closing this in favor of #1420 However, in the long term, it'd be better if the message packages are released into the ROS index (https://github.com/astuff/platform_automation_msgs/issues/7)
This is still a work in progress. I simply rebased autowarefoundation/autoware#1167 and pushed it here.

I just tested it with `bash autoware/docker/generic/run.sh` and it appears to work correctly on my 18.04 host. The results from `nvidia-smi` look correct.

issues_title: Retry commands if the build fails
issues_comment_text: One of the jobs failed (https://travis-ci.org/CPFL/Autoware/jobs/408495848) because Travis didn't even start the worker, so there isn't much this PR can do to avoid that.

issues_title: Retry commands if the build fails
issues_comment_text:
@esteve can we talk to the people at Travis?  Do you think it might be caused by one of these [1] common conditions?
[1] https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/common-build-problems/#My-build-fails-unexpectedly

issues_title: Retry commands if the build fails
issues_comment_text:
@esteve Can we solve the problem by both travis_wait for no output and travis_retry for network error?
https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/common-build-problems/#build-times-out-because-no-output-was-received

issues_title: Retry commands if the build fails
issues_comment_text:
@bdholt1 unfortunately the problem with https://travis-ci.org/CPFL/Autoware/jobs/408495848 is that the worker didn't even start, so none of the code in `.travis.yml` is even run, there's nothing we can do, except restart the build.

@kfunaoka unfortunately `travis_wait` only helps if the code in `.travis.yml` is actually run, but in many cases Travis doesn't start a worker and the build time outs, causing it to fail. The only thing that can be done in that case is to just trigger a new build.

@alexampa Thank you for the PR. We will check.

### My memo
tf::TransformBroadcaster starts subscribing topics when it is initialized.
If tf::TransformBroadcaster is a local variable (not static or not global), 
it can not send transform that is published outside the variable scope.
Additionally, this process can be extended to architectures other than aarch64, but for now I just wanted to focus on that one.

@dejanpan 

> @esteve were you able to test this on any of arm machines (e.g. drivePX2?).

Yes, though there's a couple fixups that need to be applied after compiling Autoware so that the paths make sense when running on the DrivePX. Unfortunately ROS workspaces are not easily relocatable, but a bit of `sed` fixes that:

`find devel/ -type f -exec grep -Iq . {} \; -and -exec sed -i -e 's#/sysroot/aarch64##g' {} \;`

The following line is needed if the Autoware workspace is exported to the Docker container as a volume with a different path other than the one in the DrivePX (e.g. `/home/nvidia/Autoware`):

`find devel/ -type f -exec grep -Iq . {} \; -and -exec sed -i -e 's#PATH_ON_THE_HOST#/home/nvidia/Autoware#g' {} \;`

> @esteve just one Q - what would need to happen for this PR to also work the nvidia docker as e.g. in here: #1167?

I'm working on that, but I wanted to get this first up for review. Here's what I'm doing now:

- add the `x86_64` CUDA APT repository to the `sysroot` stage Docker
- install the `cuda-*-cross-aarch64*` packages. Even if these packages are in the `x86_64` repository, they're actually targeting `arm64`. There are some packages (e.g. `cuda-license*`) that target the incorrect architecture (`all` instead of `x86_64`)
- copy the libraries and configuration files from the `sysroot` intermediate stage to `/sysroot/aarch64` in the builder stage.

I'm also trying to figure out how to this all without all the `sed` stuff, but I've given that a lower priority, as I wanted to have something working now that could be iterated from.

@kfunaoka thanks for reviewing this PR. I can confirm locally that when targeting the `develop` branch, CMake can't seem to find the LDMRS package, but it works when targeting `master`.

I made a few changes to the Travis to fetch the image from my Docker Hub and avoid building in place, since it slows down a lot the CI. I created another repository where I build the Docker image separately:

https://github.com/esteve/Autoware-crossbuild-docker-image

https://travis-ci.com/esteve/Autoware-crossbuild-docker-image
For some reason the image that gets uploaded by Travis is botched and the container can't find some of the files, I'm looking into that.

@kfunaoka I've fixed the issues in Travis, but the native Kinetic job failed for unknown reasons, you can have a look at my Travis repo (https://travis-ci.com/esteve/Autoware/jobs/135164839) to check that it passes.

I've also changed the scripts a bit so that the target architecture can be passed as an argument, so adding new targets is much easier. For example, supporting an ARMv7 or ARMv8 board is only a matter of adding two lines to the `build_cross_image.sh` script. The `catkin_make_release_aarch64` can be changed easily as well, but I've left it as is because I didn't want to make it more complex, but I can iterate in a following PR to add support for more boards.

```1. FLOAT = abs(FLOAT) doesn't really makes sense. Hence remove that.```

@Mani-Sadhasivam , @yk-fujii 
Thanks for your great works.
I'm one of the developer who contributed to implement `dpm_ttic`.

Regarding to
> `1. FLOAT = abs(FLOAT) doesn't really makes sense. Hence remove that.`

As the `thresh` is signed value, I think removing `abs` can leads to collapsing.
I suggest using `std::abs` because it has template declaration.
(Actually, `FLOAT` can be `float` or `double`. It is switched inside `Autoware/ros/src/computing/perception/detection/lib/image/dpm_ttic/cpu/switch_float.h` )

Best.

issues_comment_text: we cherry picked these changes into pacmod_apex branch.

In `nodes/ndt_matching_monitor/README.md`
* "Subscribed topics" and "Published topics" titles are incorrect, swap them.

In `nodes/ndt_matching_monitor/ndt_matching_monitor.cpp`
* Perhaps rename `score_threshold_delta` to `score_delta_threshold`. 
* The default value of `score_threshold_delta` (14) is huge even more for a difference (delta), how did you come to that value? From experiments I found a score of under 2 is reasonable, for delta should be even lower.
* In my implementation I kept the average of score values but you are using the score differences `score_delta_`. The instantaneous score difference is prone to simple errors, whereas keeping the average of "delta" values (say, over 1 second) is simple to implement and more robust. 
* The combination of  `score_delta_`  and `iteration_count_` as
```c++
if (iteration_count_ < iteration_threshold_warning_ 
    && score_delta_ < score_threshold_delta_)
```

does not warrant accurate NDT error detection. I'm sending several evaluation data over co-sense4 channel for you to see.  
* The `ndt_matching_monitor` should know when to give up: no matter how many times you initialize pose (BTW, `/initialpose` is 2D) NDT won't converge (GNSS denied environment, multipath errors, etc.) `ndt_matching_monitor` should issue some topic telling the vehicle to initiate stop maneuver or the like. However, only the output is the text message `rviz_info_text` in `overlay_info_text_pub_`. Please create some vehicle emergency topic which other programs can see and take action. For instance, publish your `ndt_status_` as a separate topic, adding a corresponding Autoware message type.

> Subscribed topics" and "Published topics" titles are incorrect, swap them.

You're right there, fixed.

> Perhaps rename score_threshold_delta to score_delta_threshold.

Changed.

> The combination of score_delta_ and iteration_count_ does not warrant accurate NDT error detection.

A statistical analysis indicates that those two features are a good indicator for when NDT is failing.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7009053/38418234-88d5d0d6-39d6-11e8-8e99-d7473f4160fa.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7009053/38418313-d0b32b92-39d6-11e8-8090-cce5401c5c43.png)


> The instantaneous score difference is prone to simple errors

Maybe this might be good. I'll evaluate with an averaged delta, instead of an instantaneous check. However, I think that averaging might not detect an accumulated error. I'll test in any case.

> The ndt_matching_monitor should know when to give up: no matter how many times you initialize pose (BTW, /initialpose is 2D) NDT won't converge.

This is already implemented. The monitor won't let NDT to run randomly.

> Please create some vehicle emergency topic which other programs can see and take action.

@bdholt1, I agree on both that you should ditch nvidia-docker v1 and that it would be better to exclude source code from the docker image. That is how we use docker at our company too.

The docker image should provide you with a development environment in which you can compile the autoware code (i.e. with all compile-time dependencies available). You can also make a runtime image which contains all the compiled software, but I would advice you to look into catkin install targets to make the deployed filesystem cleaner. When using the install targets you specify a file structure which contains only the files that need to be deployed (e.g. the binaries, launch files, param files, but not the src/header files). Just take a look at any official ros package github repo (e.g. https://github.com/ros-planning/navigation) for an example.

Some recommendations:
- figure out catkin install targets, to more cleanly deploy the code.
- consider switching to catkin_tools, rather than catkin_make. In my opinion, it is faster (especially for large catkin workspaces), cleaner, and more user friendly. It is created and maintained by the people behind ROS, but for some odd reason, it was never pushed as the official recommended successor of catkin_make (probably to avoid the migration troubles/frustrations that it would enforce to all ROS users). When switching you probably run into some cmake issues (as catkin_tools has no "cmake crosstalk" and thus is a bit more strict on your catkin correctness, i.e. the CMakeLists.xtx and package.xml). With catkin tools, just run `catkin config --install` (somewhat similar to `catkin_make install`) to enable the install space. Note that in ROS2, install targets will become obligatory (the devel workspace disappears in favor of the install workspace)..
- make two images (check e.g. apollo images too https://hub.docker.com/r/apolloauto/apollo/tags/): 
  - `autoware-dev-<version>` -> no code, no actual autoware
  - `autoware-release-<version>` -> containing deployed autoware code (no code, only binaries and "share" files like params / launch)
- for each, you need to make an nvidia and a non nvidia version (the patch I provided will make opengl apps such as rviz work for nvidia, but then its broken on intel integrated graphics...). e.g.
  - `autoware-dev-<version>-nvidia` and `autoware-dev-<version>`

We have a check_nvidia bash function that automatically can 'patch' a docker run command to take care, see this example:

```bash
check_nvidia(){
  if nvidia-smi &> /dev/null; then
    export NV_RUN="--runtime=nvidia"
    export NV_TAG_SUFFIX="-nvidia"
  else
    export NV_RUN=""
    export NV_TAG_SUFFIX=""
  fi
}

# adds GUI support and few other tricks
export DOCKER_COMMON_ARGS="--env=DISPLAY \
                           --env=XDG_RUNTIME_DIR \
                           --env=QT_X11_NO_MITSHM=1 \
                           --device=/dev/dri:/dev/dri \
                           -v /tmp/.X11-unix:/tmp/.X11-unix:rw \
                           -v /etc/localtime:/etc/localtime:ro"

xhost +local:docker
check_nvidia
docker run ${NV_RUN} ${DOCKER_COMMON_ARGS:?} -it --rm \
   --name="autoware" \
   -v /dev/bus/usb:/dev/bus/usb \
   -v /home/$USER/.Xauthority:/home/autoware/.Xauthority \
   -v "$HOME/docker_shared:/home/autoware/docker_shared" \
   -v autoware_home:/home/autoware \
   -v /media:/media \
   --net=host  \
   --add-host autoware:127.0.0.1 \
   --hostname=autoware \
   --privileged \
   autoware/autoware:1.7.0-kinetic${NV_TAG_SUFFIX}
```

Feel free to do with this advice whatever you like. I suggest you take it over from here from me and make some issues (stories) out of it if you like.
@koenlek I completely agree with your comments.  I'd love to take over here but this is a fairly substantial chunk of work so I'm going to suggest that @esteve looks into it.

hi, I summarized some points of self-driving car software architecture from your autoware package.

will you need this kind of overview or put it into github? if you need, pls tell me, and I will send to you.

following is one of snapshot:

![knowledge](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8703449/35722307-bd29f09c-0830-11e8-89c3-4728985888a0.PNG)

## Added latch support and threshold score

This can be set from the command line in the parameters section as:
`rosrun road_wizard region_tlr_mxnet _image_raw_topic:=/camera0/image_source _network_definition_file:=/PATH/TO/FILE/network_definition.json _pretrained_model_file:=/PATH/TO/FILE/pretrained_weights.params _use_gpu:=true _score_threshold:=0.95 _change_state_threshold:=5`

Being `score_threshold` default **0.9** and `change_state_threshold` is **2**.

`score_threshold` defines the minimum score to be accepted by the classifier. In the example above the classifier should report at least **0.95**, otherwise, the state returned by the node will be UNDEFINED. 

`change_state_threshold` defines the number of times the classifier should report the **same result** to be accepted as valid. Otherwise, the previous state will be reported, until a valid new result is got.

issues_comment_text: A downside that I've seen to including this in the cmake extras file as just an option is that it produces warnings on packages which do not use CUDA. Maybe we should make this a macro instead so it is only checked when invoked specifically with something like check_cuda()?
@JWhitleyAStuff can you have a look?
@sgermanserrano - The PR we discussed on Slack. This will fix some problems with the `melodic` builds too.

@JWhitleyAStuff thanks for the PR, I guess you haven't seen it but there is a [dependencies](https://github.com/autowarefoundation/autoware/blob/master/docker/generic/dependencies) file with the ROS dependencies for Autoware which is being used for the `generic` docker images and the CI. It might be good to use it also in the cross-build Docker file to keep just 1 copy of the dependencies
@sgermanserrano - Thanks for pointing that out! I'll get something pushed here that integrates that file.

@sgermanserrano - I moved the `dependencies` file up a level, to `autoware/docker`. This was necessary because that file has to be within the build context (where `docker build` is called) for all images. To make this the case, I had to modify the build scripts to `cd ..` up a level before calling `docker build` which was less disruptive than moving the scripts. I've run the cross-build for all three types, built Autoware in the `generic-aarch64` one, and done the same for the `generic` build with all options enabled. Everything seems to work correctly. You may want to verify locally as well.

@JWhitleyAStuff can you have a look at [https://github.com/astuff/autoware/pull/14](https://github.com/astuff/autoware/pull/14), I have updated the date for the cross image and the path for the FindCUDA file

Thank you for sending rosbag.
I tried several times, but the mapping  is quite difficult because there is a timing that only one pole is visible.

As a solution
・ (Recommended) Use VLP-32c etc.
VLP-32c can be seen up to 200m. So it can see the building even from the end of the circuit.
・Fusion Odometry, IMU, GNSS with EKF. We are developing this feature.

Also, this is a hack method, but you can temporarily stop the mapping and skip the locations where localization is lost, as shown below.
1. Mapping until just before localization is lost
1. pause the rosbag
1. kill ndt_slam and save the map
1. publish the map saved from Map tab of RuntimeManager
1. launch ndt_slam with `With Mapping` turned off
1. play rosbag until you can see buildings around.
1. Align self-position with 2D Pose Estimate.
1. After confirming that the self position is stable, set `With Mapping` to ON.

@TakaHoribe Thanks for attending my comments. Can you please explain:
1. How is this better than `pure_pursuit`?
1. On which scenarios will MPC outperform pure_pursuit, and which will not?
1. Can you please explain how to test with a rosbag instead of gazebo?

Thanks!

@amc-nu Answers to your question are

1.  The `mpc_follower` can use more information to follow waypoints, which enables to follow waypoints accurately. The features of the two followers are
 - `pure_pursuit` plans to move towards the **one lookahead waypoint**, assuming that **the route has constant curvature** and **angular velocity can be realized ideally**.  
 -  `mpc_follower` plans considering with **all points on the path** and **vehicle dynamics (such as steering delay)** to follow the waypoints.
2. MPC performs better when you want to drive at **complex route with low tracking error** (where the assumption of "route has constant curvature" is not apprpriate). While, the drawbacks of MPC are
 -  the difficulty of parameter tuning (it requires knowledge of control theory and vehicle dynamics). 
 - computational cost
Thus, I think the default waypoint follower is fine with `pure_pursuit` for Autoware. 
3. ok, I'll add how to test with rosbag later. (I didn't write it because rosbag test can not check how the vehicle moves with the control command generated by MPC. The rosbag test can only check if the command is published properly)

@gbiggs Is it possible to support installation of qpOASES in v1.12? If it's possible, I want to use it with MPC. In that case, I need to modify the readme and CMakelists a little. I'm not sure how long does it take to check if it can be properly installed. Should we postponed the qpOASES support to the next release? 
Even if we don't use the qp solver, this mpc_follower can be used in conditions without constraint such as steering limit.

Yes, 1.12 will have qpOASES supported via a vendor package. It's not done yet but it will be done, hopefully this week.

When you use it, please note that it is used in your README, and also add information about who created it and what license it uses (LGPL 2.1).
I added the copyright related to qpOASES. I will modify CMakelist in another PR after qpOASES support is ready. @gbiggs please check it, thanks.
@TakaHoribe the qp solver based on qpOASES is not currently compiled. What are the benefits of using the qpOASES library for the solver?

@sgermanserrano The qpOASES is for  **constrainted** optimization probem, so the MPC can calculate a control command with considering stering limit or lateral acceleration limit. While the currently used solver (based on Eigen) is just for **unconstraint** optimization problem (just least square optimization). 

Advantages of constrainted optimization is, for example, there is an improvement for the tracking accuracy on a path that can not be followed without turning the steering angle to the maximum. Solvers that know the maximum steering angle may give up the tracking accuracy of a part of the path for global optimum. On the other hand, if the solver doesn't know the maximum steering angle, it calculates the control command for perfect tracking which is actually infeasible due to the steering limit, and lose global optimality as a result.

@TakaHoribe We would like to avoid including unused code in a PR, because it cannot be tested properly and it may go stale. Can you please do the following:

1. Remove the qpOASES-related code
2. Make a separate PR that adds the qpOASES code and the necessary checks to enable it in CMake

We will make a vendor package for qpOASES in tandem with 2, and merge the two PRs simultaneously.

issues_title: Move packages probably related to messages to the messages repository
issues_comment_text:
@gbiggs - I'm happy to bloom them upstream, if given access to create (or modify after you create) the -release repository and given access to modify this one (tags, etc.).

There are several reasons we would like to be able to have these available on the ROS build farm:

1. We are creating packages internally that depend on these messages and we (and our customers) would like to not have to clone these from source every time.
2. In order to release any other packages to the build farm which rely on these messages, the messages themselves must first be available on the build farm.
3. We run CI on all of our packages. Cloning this repo and building all the packages in it from source adds 45 seconds + to each build of each package that relies on them. Seems trivial but CI build time costs money.

Just from a quick glance (not a full review), this PR has numerous problems:
- The description is woefully incomplete and lacking in detail; it doesn't even say what the actual goal of the PR is.
- It includes many hard-coded full paths which include your home directory.
- It copies and pastes entire files from elsewhere that do not appear to be necessary based on the PR description, and that have a different license to Autoware (e.g. BSD).
- It removes the copyright header from some files.
- It touches 37 files, many of them in ways that don't appear to be related to the PR.

Since this work is due for 1.12, I think we need to revise how we manage all these PRs and where they go. Please consider doing something like the following:

1. Fork the Autoware repository.
1. Pull everything from develop into master.
1. Create branches from master for your proposed changes.
1. Create PRs from your branches to the master branch in your fork.
1. Comment here with the location of those PRs so everyone can look at them and review them.
1. As each gets declared acceptable, merge it into the master of your fork.
1. When they are all done, rebase to the latest master from the upstream repository and do a PR to the master branch of the upstream repository.
1. If everything checks out fine there, which it should, we can accept that single PR rapidly, minimising the possibility of a clash with other changes that were merged during the work.

I used `colcon_release` script because I thought that the script is the replacement of  `catkin_make_release`, which Autoware Build Instruction tells the users to use. 
I thought that this would be the most "basic" way to build Autoware(at least for the first time). 
https://github.com/CPFL/Autoware/wiki/Source-Build

Also, the error won't be reproduced just by running `colcon build; colcon install` if the user has done `catkin_make` before colcon bulid. The script will make sure that "devel" directory is deleted before running colcon build.
